description:
Chapter Titles

  • Chapter 774: Vertrackte Seiten
  • Chapter 775: Das Videoportal
  • Chapter 776: Katze aus der Vase
  • Chapter 777: Eindeutig Ayumis Spuren
  • Chapter 778: Wer ist der bessere Detektiv?
  • Chapter 779: Abe-chan
  • Chapter 780: Ein magisches Rezept
  • Chapter 781: EYE
  • Chapter 782: Baumkuchen
  • Chapter 783: Crazy Diamond
  • Chapter 784: So wahr ich schwöre
name: Band 74

description:
An amazing collection nearly 20 years in the making, UDON Entertainment proudly presents Marvel vs. Capcom: Official Complete Works! This is a brand new art book collecting all of the official artwork, sketches, and bonus material from all of Marvel and Capcom’s video game collaborations—from 1993’s The Punisher arcade game right up to 2012’s smash-hit Ultimate Marvel vs. Capcom 3 for the PlayStation 3, PSP, and Xbox 360 platforms!

Compiled by UDON with the help of Capcom and Marvel, this is the first time this material has ever been collected in one place — on either side of the Pacific! Weighing in at nearly 200 pages, Marvel vs. Capcom: Official Complete Works has been a labor of love for the UDON production team. Working closely with Capcom creative head Shoei Okano, UDON has dug deep through Capcom’s archives to find extremely rare high-resolution art and materials to put together this project — no easy task, considering no Marvel vs. Capcom art book was ever printed in Japan!

Marvel vs. Capcom: Official Complete Works includes stunning artworks by Akiman, Bengus, Shinkiro, Joe Madureira, Adi Granov, and more! Complementing the classic pieces is an all-new gallery of stunning Marvel vs. Capcom illustrations by several comics superstars, including Joe Ng, Long Vo, Chamba, Adam Warren, and Takeshi Miyazawa!

Marvel vs. Capcom: Official Complete Works made its international debut at Comic-Con International: San Diego on Wednesday, July 11th, in an exclusive hardcover edition that quickly sold out! The hardcover features an exclusive wrap-around cover drawn by UDON and Marvel vs. Capcom artist Alvin Lee and digitally painted by UDON`s Genzoman. A standard-format soft cover release will follow in November 2012, distributed by Diamond to comic and bookstores everywhere.

volume.name: Marvel VS Capcom: Official Complete Works

description: Following the final issue of the original ElfQuest series, WaRP Graphic produced this bonus issue containing sketches, outlines, letters, reviews and other "Behind the Scenes" material.

Welcome to Street Fighter X Tekken, where Street Fighter and Tekken series’ stalwarts Ryu, Chun-Li, Kazuya Mishima and Nina Williams headline a memorable cast of your favorite fighters in a tag battle dream match for the ages!

Street Fighter X Tekken Artworks collects the spectacular artwork behind this historic crossover! Inside you’ll find character artwork, rough sketches, costume designs, creator commentary, interviews, and more!

Chapter Titles

  • Chapter 763: Il fantasma del tempo
  • Chapter 764: Il dominatore del tempo
  • Chapter 765: Ramen buoni da morire
  • Chapter 766: Ramen e veleno
  • Chapter 767: La verità attraverso li occhiali
  • Chapter 768: Il Jeet Kune Do
  • Chapter 769: Un detective come questo ragazzino
  • Chapter 770: Deduzione avventata durante la sera
  • Chapter 771: Dimmi cos'hai scoperto!
  • Chapter 772: La regola dei soprannomi
  • Chapter 773: Ora è possibile sparare!
name: Volume 73

description:
Chapter Titles

  • Chapter 774: Un libro impossibile da sfogliare
  • Chapter 775: Il sito dei video
  • Chapter 776: Un vaso e un gatto
  • Chapter 777: Le tracce di Ayumi
  • Chapter 778: Qual è il miglior detective?
  • Chapter 779: Abe-chan

  • Chapter 782: Il baumkuchen
  • Chapter 783: Crazy Diamonds
  • Chapter 784: La promessa durante un'ispezione
name: Volume 74

description: Chapters 785-795.
name: Volume 75
Richard Wagner's The Ring of the Nibelung

description: Hannah Washington is Ant. Her memory lost to the trials of her life as a hero, she is searching for answers to a myriad of questions. Some old friends, as well as a few new enemies are all in line to welcome her back. The heat is on in her action-packed debut in the Image Universe.
name: Volume 1

description: Cast your vote for Class President of Riverdale High! This 118 page Digital Exclusive collects some of Archie & the gang's best political rivalry stories. Will Archie get to ride on Air Force Fun? Will Betty or Veronica win the highest office in the land? Or are they all a bunch of lame ducks? This bipartisan book has all the answers!

It's an alien invasion! Join America's favorite teenage earthlings in some interplanetary fun. Are these galactic visitors friendly, or do they want to conquer the world? This 112 page Digital Exclusive collects some of the most out-of-this-world stories ever printed and features appearances by Sabrina, Little Archie, Li'l Jinx, and more!
name: TPB

description: Collecting some of the best tales from the series based on the hit cartoon, Archie and the gang continue their classic adventures - with a weird, offbeat twist! Archie is working for Riverdale High School's newspaper, investigating weird phenomena and bizarre happenings. It seems the school's science department blew a fuse in its hyper sub-molecular quarkinator, and all sorts of things are now crawling and slithering through the town! It's up to Archie to look into the cases... and usually he happens to be there when they are resolved as well. All of the gang from the pop television series shows up, including occasional appearances from their own Sabrina the Teenage Witch, popular comic book character of the 1970s and popular television character of the late 1990s.
name: TPB

description: When Archie's cousin Andrew comes to Riverdale there's never a dull moment! And on this visit, he's not alone! The villainous Mad Doctor Doom and his organization C.R.U.S.H have targeted the students of Riverdale High with a devious plan to turn them into the Walking Dazed! But when Andrew gets captured it's up to Archie and his agents of R.I.V.E.R.D.A.L.E. to stop the spread of Formula Z, rescue Andrew and help capture the mysterious Sharry, the Spy Girl. Collects 'The Blackest (and Bluest) Day,' 'R.I.V.E.R.D.A.L.E Dissembled,' 'The Crisis At Riverdale High,' and 'The Walking Dazed.'
name: TPB

description: It's Jughead's dog, HOT DOG! What's that scamp up to now?
name: GN

description: The Decepticon Civil War comes to a close as Megatron advances on Bludgeon.
name: At Fight's End

description: Grab your wallets, it's time for a SHOPPING SPREE!

Welcome to Baneberry Academy! This is a school not unlike your own, full of cliques of like-minded individuals. But there is one thing that makes this academy quite different. It's full of fairies. That's right, the winged creatures you believed were a myth are, in fact, real and those that have fallen by the wayside have made their way here. It's a new semester at Beneberry and that means there will be new faces to meet. So, come meet the students and staff of Baneberry Academy for Wayward Fairies!
name: Vol. 1

volume.name: Baneberry Creek: Academy For Wayward Fairies

description: A 'Return of the Originals' event! Before the caped crusader patrolled the streets, before horn head prowled the back alleys, this original dark avenger hunted evil men. The Black Bat is back, and hell's coming with him! Blinded in a mobster's attempt to destroy evidence, DA Anthony Quinn sharpens his other senses and uses his sixth 'radar' sense to work outside the law, doing whatever it takes to bring criminals to justice.
name: TPB

volume.name: Return of the Originals: Black Bat

description: A collection of dark, twisted horror stories designed to get into your head and under your skin. Nobody is safe. Nothing is off limits. No one can be trusted. This tome of twisted and sometimes horrific tales explains why not all damaged goods can be returned! Damaged Goods is primal horror that permeates your very soul and will be sure to stay with you long after you put the book down!
name: OGN

description: A crime fighter is genetically engineered to be a super-hero - but when the test goes awry and he doesn't have the superhero qualities needed, he has to be teamed up with a former CIA agent who is the brains behind the duo. One gets all the glory while one has all the power. Collects issues 1-4 as well as the Holiday Special one-shot!
name: TPB

description: A geeky romantic comedy from the illustrator of MARRY ME! Jess is a girl who loves comic books. That's not strange, there are lots of girls who love comics. But she may be the only girl in the world who opened up her very own comic book shop in order to get closer to the guy she likes! NO PINK PONIES is the story of a girl, a guy, and a comic book shop. This volume collects comic strips from February 7, 2006 to February 7, 2008.
name: Vol. 1

description: What do you get when you match up Jon Stewart, the most watched and most liberal comedic host verses Bill O'Reilly, the conservative, brash host of the most watched opinion show on cable television? A Rock 'Em Sock 'Em Robots battle for the ages! To prepare for their much anticipated October 6th pay-per-view Internet debate, learn all there is to know about funny man Jon Stewart and the exuberant, one-of-a-kind Fox host Bill O'Reilly in "Political Power: O'Reilly Stewart 2012."

Satan's Circus of Hell contains horrific humor in the classic pulp comics tradition, and enough sex, sleaze and sadism to corrupt modern minds. Reader discretion is advised. Robert Steven Rhine (Girl's and Corpses) presents a horror anthology loaded with more gore, terror and humor that you can swallow--or choke on! It's dark, horrific and very funny. This full color graphic fiction extravaganza features the top horror illustrators from around the world. This issue brings four tales of terror. "Hell's Bell's" (Nenad Gucunja) tells the tales of the notorious serial killers of the world and their times down below, "Monkey Grinder" (David Hartman) is the story of an old man and his sick monkey, "Gas Pains" (Tim Vigil) delivers a pregnant girl's woes, literally. In "Separation Anxiety" a circus freak love affair goes horribly wrong. Pinups by Nenad Gucunja and Jeff Gaither,

Sixty years in the future, Earth is protected by the Shockrockets--an unbeatable squadron of hi-tech aircraft, built from a fusion of alien technology and the best Earth has to offer. Manned by the world's most elite pilots, the Shockrockets protect an unstable Earth as it rebuilds from a devastating invasion from space. Young, tech-mad Alejandro Cruz becomes the newest Shockrockets pilot by a freak of chance. Can he get up to speed before the Shockrockets' greatest foe takes over the world? Shockrockets delivers all-out aerial action and science fiction thrills, courtesy of Kurt (Astro City) Busiek and Stuart (Ultimate Spider-Man) Immonen.
name: TPB

description: A BOLD EXPERIMENT IN THE GRAPHIC NOVEL! KRISTIANSEN's European Album is newly translated to English by TEDDY KRISTIANSEN and STEVEN T. SEAGLE. But in a unique flip-novel format, the book is also 're-mixed' with a completely different script devised by SEAGLE before he collaborated on the translation. Both versions - THE RED DIARY - a tale of art forgery and World War and THE RE[A]D DIARY - a tale of identity theft and lost love - comprise this unique graphic novel from SEAGLE and KRISTIANSEN - the Eisner nominated/winning team behind the acclaimed Vertigo graphic novel it's a bird...
name: GN

volume.name: The Red Diary / The Re[a]d Diary

description:
Collecting the six-issue series in one volume, along with a complete cover gallery featuring art by Joe Linsner. Spinning out of Alan Moore's retelling of the ageless horror classic, Dracula has come to America to play out his timeless narrative in this brave, New World. Only he didn't realize ANOTHER vampire already beat him to it. Drawn to one another across continents and centuries by a mysterious force, both Vampirella and Bram Stoker's immortal monster find themselves sucked into a time-tossed epic of love, hate, death, and damnation. But can an epic built for one vampire possibly hold them both?

Also contains the classic story "The New European" by Alan Moore and Gary Frank.
name: TPB

description: "Never hug and kiss them, never let them sit on your lap. The end result is a happy child, free as air, because he has mastered the stupidly simple demands society makes upon him." Psychologists know best, and in the 1950s they warned parents about the dangers of too much love. Besides, what was "love" anyway? Just another name for children seeking food and adults seeking sex. It took Harry Harlow, a deeply unhappy man who knew in his gut the truth about what love - and its absence - meant, to prove otherwise. His experiments, and their results, shocked the world.

volume.name: Wire Mothers: Harry Harlow & the Science of Love

description: Nautical and astronomical themes abound in this collection of five short tales: the long lost journals of famed explorer/adventurer Chance Oxblood; the most significant year in the life of the personified former-planet Pluto; strange happenings in the Black Forest; mermaid dreams and sacrificial rites to a Grendel; and the tribulations of a recovering alcoholic gone model-building novice.

person_credits.name: Grant Reynolds
person_credits.role: writer, penciler, letterer, inker, colorist, cover

description:
Contents

  • Contents and Credits/ From the Desk of the Editor... (inside cover)
  • "Simon Furman: Up Close and Personal" (page 1)
  • Dreadwind profile (page 2)
  • Smokejumper profile (page 3)
  • OTFCC 2004 ad (page 4)
  • Beast Wars: Primeval Dawn comic (pages 5-12)
  • Megabolt profile (page 13)
  • Jhiaxus profile (page 14)
  • Fan Artwork Gallery I (page 15)
  • RetroReview: Generation 2 Go-Bots by Jennifer Ulm (page 16)
  • "The Media Sentinel" by Phil N. Zeman (page 17)
  • Sam's Club Exclusive Optimus Prime profile (page 18-19)
  • Sunstorm profile (page 20)
  • Ad for Dreamwave comics (page 21)
  • "Less Than Zero" parody by David Willis and "One-Shot 'Bots" by Graham Weaver (page 22)
  • Armada: More Than Meets The Eye preview (page 23)
  • "Crazy Customizations: Megawing Galvatron" by Robert Yee (page 24-25)
  • Fan Artwork Gallery II (page 26)
  • "Genesis Redux" (page 27)
  • "SuperDeformed Fan" comic by Matt Nelson (inside back cover)
name: Beast Wars: Primeval Dawn; Part 1

volume.name: The Official Transformers Collectors' Club Magazine

description: Satan's Circus of Hell contains horrific humor in the classic pulp comics tradition, and enough sex, sleaze and sadism to corrupt modern minds. Reader discretion is advised. In this giant-sized horror anthology is loaded with tons of gore and humor that any hardcore horror fan will enjoy - especially fans of Tales from the Crypt and Creepshow. It features 43 stories illustrated by 43 of the top horror comic book artists including William Stout, Tim Vigil, John Cassaday, Hilary Barta, Steve Bissette, Jim Smith, Tone Rodriguez, John Howard, David Hartman, Tommy Castillo, Jacob Hair, Steve Mannion and Aly Fell. Four years in the making, this classic collection of sick and twisted short stories is a true labor of blood. It includes the first prize winner of the 2005 WORLD HORROR CON dark fiction contest, Propeller Boy.

Satan's Circus of Hell contains horrific humor in the classic pulp comics tradition, and enough sex, sleaze and sadism to corrupt modern minds. Reader discretion is advised. Robert Steven Rhine (Girl's and Corpses) presents a horror anthology loaded with more gore, terror and humor that you can swallow--or choke on! It's dark, horrific and very funny. This full color graphic fiction extravaganza features the top horror illustrators from around the world. This issue brings six tales of terror. "Beached Whale" (John Watkins Chow) tells the tale of a group of friends and their discovery on a beach , "Anna" (Tone Rodriguez) is the story of a geek who gets his sweet revenge, "SAM R I " (Mark Covell) takes us back to the high school recess where a bully tries to take advantage of a wimpy kid. In "The Adventures of Dr. Narcolepsy" (Kevin Colden) a doctor takes a holiday at the wrong time. "The Magician From Hell" (D.W. Frydendall) is a tale of gore and magic. The issue closes out with a tale of robotic terror--"LEZBOTS". Pinups by Nenad Gucunja, Bryan Baugh David Hartman, Alex Pardee

Collecting the stunning cover art from the hit mini-series WARHAMMER 40,000: DAMNATION CRUSADE and WARHAMMER 40,000: BLOOD AND THUNDER, the WARHAMMER 40,000 COVER GALLERY SPECIAL features 30 savage full-page, text-free images of Space Marines, Dreadnoughts, Imperial Guardsmen, Orks and other war-driven inhabitants of the bloody 41st Millennium.

In the grim darkness of the far future, there is only war...

From the people that brought you Violet Rose, 10th Muse, and VSS! Welcome to Baneberry Academy! This is a school not unlike your own, full of cliques of like-minded individuals. But there is one thing that makes this academy quite different. It's full of fairies. That's right, the winged creatures you believed were a myth are in fact real and those that have fallen by the wayside have made their way here. It's a new semester at Baneberry and that means there will be new faces to meet. So come meet the students and staff of Baneberry Academy for Wayward Fairies!

volume.name: Baneberry Creek: Academy For Wayward Fairies

description: Last time we met Iris. Now meet Link. She's the strong, silent type, but she has a secret. Around the other girls, she's a leader, all others will follow her. But something scares Link. Something she can't talk about with anyone else. In order for her to grow and be a better friend to the others, she'll have to learn what it means to be a part of a group, to have others count on you, and what it means to truly be one of the girls.

volume.name: Baneberry Creek: Academy For Wayward Fairies

description: Something horrible is on it's way to Baneberry Academy, but before it can get there, the girls get to have a dance with the boys school! We cast our light down on Sierra this time and what it means, for her, to be a fairy. She's had a rough life, and coming to Baneberry has been a dream come true. But as the dance rears its ugly head and Sierra can't find a date, she's forced to make a bad decision that might affect all of the school.

volume.name: Baneberry Creek: Academy For Wayward Fairies

description: The Academy is under siege from the evil Kraken, who has been pulling strings from behind the scenes since before the girls met. We also take a closer look at Gloss, the loner of the group. The strongest and most mysterious of the group, Gloss has been hiding a secret from the others, something that might just tear them apart, right when they need to be their strongest. Horrible things have happened to the other girls, and Gloss has to make a choice. Will she save them?

volume.name: Baneberry Creek: Academy For Wayward Fairies

description: One of the all-time best and most highly acclaimed graphic novels ever is now, finally, back in print! Dave McKean, famous for Arkham Asylum and his covers for Sandman, presents a highly allegorical tale of the dwellers of an apartment building. Running in parallel lines or tangentially, the differing lives each have their own tale to tell under the magic spin of McKean's brilliant imagery and story-telling. It's about a blocked painter, a controversial novelist, and a wise musician. It may be about God, about Jazz, about sex, but also about creativity and artistic fulfillment.

person_credits.name: Dave McKean
person_credits.role: writer, artist, penciler, letterer, inker, colorist, cover

description:
Contents

  • "Interview: The Voice of Optimus Prime SPEAKS!!!" by Scott Marble (pages 3 and 4)
  • "Hasbro NEWS!" with an interview with the Titanium Team (page 5)
  • "Micro-Sized" (page 6)
  • Mini-Con profiles: Deepdive, Overcast, Longarm.
  • Mini Mayhem!
  • Lil Formers
  • Maximal Command Security Force profiles: 9K, Overshoot, Switchblade (page 7)
  • Classics Grimlock bio (page 8)
  • Classics Mirage bio (page 9)
  • The Black Sea of Sandokan prologue by Benson Yee
  • "Crossing Over, Part 1" comic (pages 11-16)
name: Crossing Over, Part 1

description: MAD is at it again! We're collecting our best - if that's the right word - Batman parodies in one big package! It's enough to drive you batty!

COBRA COMMAND AFTERMATH! It's a new day for the JOEs-as they crawl from the ruins of "Cobra Command", they find a new status quo... and a change in command! The stories from G.I. JOE, SNAKE EYES, And COBRA converge in this volume plus the G.I. JOE: Cobra Annual is included.

Collects (Cobra Annual 2012, G.I. Joe #12, Snake Eyes #12 &Cobra #12)
name: Vol. 3: Aftermath

description:
The Cobra Civil War is over but there's no risk of a peace outbreak. 'Cobra Command' starts here as the new Cobra Commander kicks off his reign with total war as he invades a sovereign nation with all the military might under his power.

Collects (G.I. Joe #9, Snake Eyes #9, Cobra #9 & G.I. Joe #10)
name: Vol. 1

description:
COBRA COMMAND CONCLUDES! The new COBRA COMMANDER is on a path of conquest and destruction. The G.I. JOE, SNAKE EYES, and COBRA story lines converge in this second volume as the JOES struggle to survive. Everything changes here! Who lives-who dies-who wins? The answers aren't what you expect, and the foundation for the future of G.I. JOE starts here!

Collects (Snake Eyes #10, Cobra #10, G.I. Joe #11, Snake Eyes #11 & Cobra #11)
name: Vol. 2

description:
The endless zombie hordes of INFESTATION are defeated... but now a greater threat looms in INFESTATION 2! The balance of magic has been tipped allowing the nightmares of H.P. Lovecraft, the ELDER GODS, to break through their cosmic prison and attack all known realities in the IDW universe!

Collects Infestation 2 #1-2, Infestation 2 Team-Up and Infestation 2: 30 Days of Night.
name: Volume 1

description:
The Lovecraftian monsters invade the worlds of TRANSFORMERS and G.I. JOE in INFESTATION 2. It's a steam-punk world in the grips of panic as terrifying beings from the depths of the ocean corrupt both humans and DECEPTICONS! Meanwhile, COBRA has always had a penchant for dark experiments. This time they've gone too far and opened a portal to a realm of violence and madness. As squadron after squadron of Cobra Vipers falls under the thrall of the Elder Gods there seems no way to stop the hideous transformations that are taking place. Can SNAKE EYES stop it?

Collects Infestation 2: G.I. Joe #1-2 & Infestation 2: Transformers #1-2.
name: Volume 2

description:
Introducing the D&D campaign EBERRON to comics and learn the strange history it shares with the threat of INFESTATION 2. Also, one of the Turtles has been taken by something in the dark depths of the sewers, and it's up to his brothers to save him. When it all comes down to the final battle, C.V.O. is scattered across America, and one of their own may be the key to stopping the threat once and for all-but not without a tremendous sacrifice. Danger Girl and others are on hand to help, but will it be enough?

Collects Infestation 2: Dungeons & Dragons #1-2 and Infestation 2: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles #1-2
name: Volume 3

description:
Contents

  • Overview of the movie preview hosted by Michael Bay, by Rik Alvarez (pages 3 & 4)
  • Toy Fair coverage (page 5)
  • "Micro-Sized" (page 6)
  • Mini-Con profiles: Nightscream, Nightcruz, Nightcreeper.
  • Mini Mayhem! "Lil' Jerry returns"
  • Lil Formers
  • Maximal Command Security Force profiles: High Beam, Shatterpoint, Getout (page 7)
  • Classics Astrotrain bio (page 8)
  • Classics Skywarp bio (page 9)
  • The Razor's Edge prologue by Benson Yee
  • "Crossing Over, Part 2" comic (pages 11-16)
name: Crossing Over, Part 2

description: The Elder Gods of H.P. Lovecraft invade the worlds of IDW in Infestation 2! The call of Cthulhu infests 30 Days of Night, Dungeons & Dragons, G.I. JOE, Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles, and Transformers. If zombies weren't bad enough, how do you stop inter-dimensional monsters?
name: HC

description: It's been two months since Lone Ranger and Tonto hit the trails of the old west, looking for injustice. They've found plenty. Now, they come across settlers who have been victimized in a way that stirs memories in John Reid. Loss, vengeance, and redemption as pioneer idealism meets the reality of hard life on the prairie. Continuing and expanding on Dynamite's past Lone Ranger series, with new writer Ande Parks at the helm! An epic six part story (The Lone Ranger Vol 2 #1-6) that will test the mettle of the west's most legendary heroes, collected in The Lone Ranger Vol 5: Hard Country TP, along with a complete cover gallery.
name: Vol. 5

description:
As the Iron Man cast reels from last issue's stunning events, the Golden Avenger himself begins to unravel at the seams! But when fear begins to wrap its icy fingers around the globe and the people need Iron Man more than ever, will Tony Stark be able to answer the call?

Plus, the finale of THE GALACTUS SEED! Odin and Galactus are ready to fight one another to the death and only Thor and the Silver Surfer stand between them... and us! And in Fallen Asgard, Volstagg leads an unlikely army in aide of man and Asgardian alike...but what if only Loki holds the key to saving the day?!

Includes material reprinted from Invincible Iron Man Vol. 1 #505-506 and Mighty Thor Vol.4 #6! 76 pages!

Who is Brik Jones? The character is the Interstellar appointed Attorney for Earth. The Ashcan story, "The Case of Case number 69" is a “day in the life” type of story told well after the classic comics style origin story.
name: The Case of Case Number 69

volume.name: Brik Jones: Attorney For Earth Ashcan

description:
Contents

  • Interview with Tom DeSanto by Scott Marble (pages 3 & 10)
  • Movie toy spread (page 4-5)
  • "Micro-Sized" (pages 6-7)
  • Mini-Con profiles: Heavy Load, Stripmine, Drill Bit.
  • Mini Mayhem! "movie line"
  • Lil Formers
  • Classics Rodimus bio (page 8)
  • Classics Ramjet bio (page 9)
  • "Crossing Over: Part 3" comic (pages 11-16)
name: Crossing Over, Part 3

description:
Contents

  • Wreckers: Finale Part I comic (pages 3-7)
  • "A World Transformed" interview with Roberto Orci and Alex Kurtzman, by Scott Marble (pages 7 & 10)
  • TCC Movie Review: Transformers by Rob Meyer (page 7)
  • "Classicverse" Mini-Con bios: Overbite, Grindor, Broadside, Knockdown, Firebot, Nightscream (page 8)
  • Breakaway bio (page 9)
  • Crossing Over: Part 4 comic (pages 11-16)

Note: The Wreckers: Finale Part 1 is only the first 4 pages that were completed by 3H before they went bankrupt. The remaining story was released and approved by Hasbro. The story was finished in The Wreckers: Finale Part II.
name: Crossing Over, Part 4; The Wreckers: Finale Part 1

description:
Contents

  • "Megatron Speaks... and Optimus Too!" A Talk with David Kaye by Scott Marble (pages 3 & 10)
  • "Eric Siebenaler Gets Animated" interview with Eric Siebenaler, by J.E. Alvarez (pages 4-5)
  • "Classicverse" Mini-Con bios: Dreadwing, Terrorsaur, Oil Slick, Strongarm, Sledge, Steel Wind (page 6)
  • "Matt Moylan presents Lil Formers" (page 7)
  • Cliffjumper bio (page 8)
  • Megatron bio (page 9)
  • Crossing Over: Part 5 comic (pages 11-16)
name: Crossing Over, Part 5

description: Locked up for a crime he didn't commit, burnt out detective Egon Rustemagick is released from a high security mental institution in order to catch a serial-killing monster who is murdering and mutilating housewives and young children. Thus STRAY TOASTERS, the legendary seminal graphic novel written and painted by one of the world's most innovative and influential comic book artists, BILL SIENKIEWICZ. STRAY TOASTERS, a full-color definitive annotated volume, showcases SIENKIEWICZ at the top of his game. Contains new cover, cover gallery and a few surprises.
name: TPB

description:
Contents

  • Hasbro Interview-A Conversation with Mick Ballog by Scott Marble (pages 3 & 10)
  • BotCon: Past, Present, and Future by Karl Hartman (pages 4-5)
  • "Classicverse" Mini-Con bios: Snarl, Dirt Rocket, Wideload, Swoop, Divebomb, Thunderwing (page 6)
  • "Matt Moylan presents Lil Formers" (page 7)
  • Optimus Prime bio (page 8)
  • Starscream bio (page 9)
  • Crossing Over: Part 6 comic (pages 11-16)
name: Crossing Over, Part 6

description: For the first time in over ten years, Bill Sienkiewicz's incredible Stray Toasters is available for the fans in trade paperback format!! Written and painted by Sienkiewicz in the latter part of the 20th century, this book was originally published as a trade softcover by Epic/Marvel Comics. Sold out and unavailable for many years, Graphitti Designs through a special arrangement with Bill Sienkiewicz is producing a limited quantity of this influential book in softcover form. Features new cover artwork by Sienkiewicz. Don't miss out on this opportunity to enjoy some of Sienkiewicz's finest work.
name: TPB

description:
Contents

  • Cartoon Network Interview: A Conversation with Derrick Wyatt (pages 3 & 9)
  • The Classics are Back! (pages 4-5)
  • Club Exclusive Preview (page 6)
  • Mini Mayhem! by Jesse Wittenrich (page 7)
  • Fan Art Spotlight (page 8)
  • Transcendent: Part 1 comic (pages 10-15)
  • Gone Too Far 1-page preview (page 16)
name: Transcendent, Part 1

description:
Contents

  • Thus... Spake... Megatron... A Corey Burton Interview! by Scott Marble (p. 3 and p. 9)
  • An Animated Deluge of Deluxe Toys! (p. 4-5) - preview photos of the then-upcoming Animated Deluxes, including Blackarachnia, Ratchet, Snarl, Soundwave, Jazz and Oil Slick.
  • Mini Mayhem! (p. 6) - Jean Gray catches Cyclops ogling Animated Blackarachnia.
  • Lil Formers (p. 7) - The Animated cast meets their Generation 1 counterparts.
  • Fan Artist Spotlight (page 8) - Joshua Chipman (Oil Slick vs. Jazz) and Jon Bales ("Shattered Glass" Starscream)
  • Transcendent: Part 2 comic (pages 10-15)
  • Withered Hope 1-page preview comic (page 16)
name: Transcendent: Part 2

description:
Contents

  • "The Event that was BotCon 2008!" by Mike Albert (page 3)
  • "At... BotCon," a gallery of upcoming toys, including 25th Anniversary Optimus Prime and Universe Deluxe wave 3, plus Animated Deluxe wave 4 and Voyager wave 4. (pages 4-5 and 9)
  • Mini Mayhem! (p. 6) - Robot Heroes invade BotCon 2008.
  • Lil Formers (p. 7) - The Shattered Glass characters make obvious non-jokes about their counterparts.
  • Fan Artist Spotlight (page 8) - This issue's feature artist is Donald Franz, Jr.
  • Transcendent: Part 3 comic (pages 10-15)
  • I, Lowtech 1-page preview comic (page 16)
name: Transcendent: Part 3

description:
This month's cover, featuring the art of Evan Gauntt, kicks off our next series of prose fiction, all set in the Shatteredverse (the time-line featured in this year's BotCon story "Shattered Glass"). First up, Dungeons and Dinobots, a story chronicling a change of sorts for one savage Autobot...be sure to check out the prologue for the story on page 5.

Contents

  • "A Chat with Marty Isenberg" by Scott Marble (pages 3-4)
  • "Artist Spotlight" featuring Chad Porter (Page 4)
  • "Dungeons & Dinobots," a text story by Greg Sepelak and S. Trent Troop (page 5)
  • Profiles for Slag, Minerva, Muzzle, Lug, Quig, Cheetor, and Shockwave (pages 6-9)
  • "Transcendent: Part 4" comic (pages 10-15)
  • Mini Mayhem! by Jesse Wittenrich
name: Transcendent: Part 4

description:
Issue 23 of Transformers Collectors' Club Magazine features an in depth look at the upcoming 25th Anniversary with an amazing toy preview, an interview with Bill Rawley and a chat with Susan Blu, a staple with Transformers since almost the very beginning. That mixed with all the other great features; profiles, reviews and the ongoing Club Comic, this is one issue you don't want to miss!

Contents

  • "The Voice of Susan Blu" (page 3 and 7)
  • "An Interview with Hasbro's Bill Rawley," featuring first-looks at Universe Deluxes Dinobot, Hot Shot, Legends Cosmos, Warpath, Wheelie, and Rodimus, Mighty Muggs Bumblebee and Soundwave, and Robot Heroes wave 4. (pages 4-6)
  • Transformers: Cybertron: The Ultimate Collection, DVD Review by R.M. Eljay (page 6)
  • "Artist Spotlight" featuring Teresa Levy (Page 7)
  • Profiles for TransTech Prowl and Starscream (pages 8-9)
  • "Transcendent: Part 5" comic (pages 10-15)
  • Comics Around Cybertron and Mini Mayhem!, and "Rob's Hot Pick!: Onslaught" (page 16)
name: Transcendent: Part 5

description: Dana's shocking secret is revealed!
name: Legends of the Dark Knight: Dana Part Two

description:
That's right...Issue 24 of the Transformer's Collectors' Club Magazine will be featuring G1 inspired Animated Tech Specs. Since Issue 24 is our Season 3 Animated preview issue, we are kicking things off with TEN Tech Specs featuring the crew led by Rodimus and Strika's band of na'er do wells!

But wait, there's more! Each issue in 2009 will feature two additional Tech Specs, bringing your total to 22! You can either clip and save or keep them in the magazine, but how ever you do it, just don't miss them!

Contents

  • Transformers Animated: Looking back... Looking Forward!, an interview by J. E. Alvarez with Eric Siebenaler and Derrick Wyatt, along with Animated character development sketches (p. 3 + 6-7)
  • Animated Tech Specs: Rodimus Prime, Ironhide, Red Alert, Hot Shot, Brawn (p. 4); Strika, Cyclonus, Blackout, Spittor, Oil Slick (p. 5)
  • TransTech bio: Optimus Prime (p. 8)
  • Transcendent: Part 6 - comic story (p. 9-14)
  • TransTech bio: Optimus Prime (p. 15)
  • Around Cybertron (featuring a plush lizard), Rob's Hot Pick!: Blitzwing (Animated), and Mini Mayhem! (back cover)
name: Transcendent: Part 6

person_credits.name: Scott Morse
person_credits.role: writer, artist, penciler, letterer, inker, colorist, cover

description:
Year 5 of the TCC Magazine starts off with a bang as we head back to the Shatteredverse for the thrilling conclusion to our 5 year story arc. What awaits Landquake, Breakaway and Topspin in this strange, backwards Universe? Has Skyfall truly met his end? Where will they turn for help as things seem to go from bad to worse? All this and more in our next exciting issue! Artist Yuki Oshima of Kiss Play fame did us the great honor of creating an amazing cover for the "Do Over" prose story, which we also used as the cover to Issue 25.

Contents

  • Animated Tech Specs for Wheeljack and Laserbeak (p. 3)
  • Transformers: How It All Began, an interview with former Hasbro VP of Boy's Toys Marketing Bob Prupis (p. 3)
  • Hasbro Flashback - Hasbro employees reminisce about their experiences with the brand (p. 4-5)
  • TransTech Blackarachnia, Classics Topspin, and "Shattered Glass" Whisper - bios in the style of More than Meets the Eye (p. 6-8)
  • The Transformers Club Comic Years 1-4: Our Story So Far... a 1-page text recap of Balancing Act, Revelations, Crossing Over, and Transcendent. (p. 9)
  • Reunification: Part 1 - comic story (p. 10-15)
  • Around Cybertron, Rob's Hot Pick!: Cyclonus, and Mini Mayhem! (back cover)
name: Reunification: Part 1

description:
Contents

  • Brian's Bytes and Bolts; From the Editor's Desk (inside cover)
  • "Bots Vs Cons" Animated Tech Specs for Highbrow and Reflector
  • "Transformers Generation 2:" by Karl Hartman, a short article about unreleased G2 toys. (p. 3)
  • Transformers at Toy Fair - 2-page spread of upcoming toys from Animated (Arcee, Soundwave/Ratbat), Universe (Ratchet, Hot Shot), and Revenge of the Fallen (Human Alliance Bumblebee, Leader Optimus Prime, Voyager Starscream, Devastator) - pp. 4-5
  • Shattered Profile: Dirge (p. 6)
  • Shattered Profile: Sky Lynx (p. 7-8)
  • Shattered Profile: Ravage (p. 8) (he's waving!)
  • BotCon 2009 Preview! - Kup narrates an introduction to the "Wings of Honor" comic book (and toy set).
  • Reunification: Part 2 - comic story (p. 10-15)
  • Around Cybertron, Rob's Hot Pick!: Swindle, and Mini Mayhem! (back cover)
name: Reunification: Part 2

description: A mix of James Bond and Indiana Jones with the bank account of Donald Trump, Richie Rich and the gang of Rich Rescue are altruistic explorers who travel the world in search of adventure! After 20 years away from comics, Richie Rich returns with all new tales! This digest collects the 'The Pursuit of Pesos,' 'Ma Ma My Irona,' and 'Hello Fellow Hostages, Are You Ready To Rock?'! Plus, a wealth of classic Richie Rich tales digitally re-mastered and re-colored for the first time ever!
name: The Pursuit of Pesos & Other Stories!
